str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular

str2: Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 2nd Person Singular
str2: Yours, thy, thine. From su; thine.
Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.
